DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating the type of cytogenetic abnormality present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.

Concepts.definition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the presence of a third copy of chromosome 22 in somatic cells.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the presence of a third copy of chromosome 22 in somatic cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the presence of a third copy of chromosome 21 in somatic cells.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the presence of a third copy of chromosome 21 in somatic cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the presence of a third copy of chromosome 8 in somatic cells.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the presence of a third copy of chromosome 8 in somatic cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenic abnormality that refers to loss of all or part of the long arm of chromosome 20 (20q).

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to loss of all or part of the long arm of chromosome 20 (20q).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the allelic loss of all or part of the short arm of chromosome 17.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the loss of all or part of the short arm of chromosome 17 (17p).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to deletion of part of the long arm of chromosome 9. It is associated with the development of acute myeloid leukemia and various types of carcinomas.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the loss of all or part of the long arm of chromosome 9 (9q).  It is associated with the development of acute myeloid leukemia and various types of carcinomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to deletion of part of the long arm of chromosome 7. It is associated with the development of chronic myelomonocytic leukemia with eosinophilia, refractory anemia with excess blasts, refractory anemia with multilineage dysplasia, and refractory anemia with multilineage dysplasia and ringed sideroblasts.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to loss of all or part of the long arm of chromosome 7 (7q). It is associated with the development of chronic myelomonocytic leukemia with eosinophilia, refractory anemia with excess blasts, refractory anemia with multilineage dysplasia, and refractory anemia with multilineage dysplasia and ringed sideroblasts.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenic abnormality that refers to loss of all or part of chromosome 7.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to loss of all or part of chromosome 7.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenic abnormality that refers to loss of all or part of chromosome 5.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to loss of all or part of chromosome 5.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosome band present on 14q

Concepts.definition: A chromosome band present on 14q

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Proximal (short) arm of chromosome 9

Concepts.definition: Proximal (short) arm of chromosome 9

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosome band present on 11q

Concepts.definition: A chromosome band present on 11q

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distal (long) arm of chromosome 6

Concepts.definition: Distal (long) arm of chromosome 6

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the translocation of 10q24 with 14q11, leading to inappropriate and abundant expression of HOX11 protein in T cells bearing the translocation.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the translocation of 10q24 with 14q11, leading to inappropriate and abundant expression of HOX11 protein in T cells bearing the translocation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosomal abnormality in which the chromosomal number is less than the normal diploid number.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal abnormality in which the chromosomal number is less than the normal diploid number.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosomal abnormality in which the chromosomal number is greater than the normal diploid number.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal abnormality in which the chromosomal number is greater than the normal diploid number.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This gene is involved in both transcription and lymphocyte development.: The result of any gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, including all sequences transcribed into RNA.

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in both transcription and lymphocyte development.
The result of any gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, including all sequences transcribed into RNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in both transcription in hematopoietic cells and lymphocyte development.: The result of any gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, including all sequences transcribed into RNA.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in both transcription in hematopoietic cells and lymphocyte development.
The result of any gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, including all sequences transcribed into RNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mutation in a RAS family gene (HRAS, KRAS or NRAS) that causes the encoded GTPase to be resistant to GTP hydrolysis and results in constitutive activation of its activity and downstream pathways.

Concepts.definition: A mutation in a RAS family gene (HRAS, KRAS or NRAS) that causes the encoded GTPase to be resistant to GTP hydrolysis and results in constitutive activation of its activity and downstream pathways.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of the IKZF1 gene.

Concepts.definition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of the IKZF1 gene.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A translocation between chromosomes 12 and 21 involved in TEL-AML1 oncogene formation. The translocation produces a chimeric gene encoding a protein consisting of the N-terminal HLH domain of the TEL ETS-like transcription factor fused with a nearly complete AML1 protein. t(12;21) is the most frequent translocation causing ALL, accounting for 20% of ALL cases.

Concepts.definition: A translocation between chromosomes 12 and 21 involved in TEL-AML1 oncogene formation. The translocation produces a chimeric gene encoding a protein consisting of the N-terminal HLH domain of the TEL ETS-like transcription factor fused with a nearly complete AML1 protein. t(12;21) is the most frequent translocation causing ALL, accounting for 20% of ALL cases.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A molecular abnormality indicating rearrangement of the JAK2 gene.

Concepts.definition: A molecular abnormality indicating rearrangement of the JAK2 gene.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of the TP53 gene.

Concepts.definition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of the TP53 gene.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A translocation between chromosomes 9 and 22 that is associated with the Philadelphia chromosome.

Concepts.definition: A translocation between chromosomes 9 and 22 that is associated with the Philadelphia chromosome.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that involves a translocation between chromosomes 8 and 22.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that involves a translocation between chromosomes 8 and 22.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that involves a translocation between chromosomes 2 and 8.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that involves a translocation between chromosomes 2 and 8.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that involves a translocation between chromosomes 8 and 14.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that involves a translocation between chromosomes 8 and 14.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the translocation of 4q21 with 11q23.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the translocation of 4q21 with 11q23.3.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosomal translocation that fuses 8q24 with 14q32. This juxtaposes the MYC gene with the promoter regions of the immunoglobulin heavy chain gene locus, which results in overexpression of Myc proto-oncogene protein in B-cells bearing the translocation.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal translocation that fuses 8q24 with 14q32. This juxtaposes the MYC gene with the promoter regions of the immunoglobulin heavy chain gene locus, which results in overexpression of Myc proto-oncogene protein in B-cells bearing the translocation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the translocation of 19p13.3 with 1q23, resulting in the fusion of the TCF3 (E2A) gene with the PBX1 gene.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the translocation of 19p13.3 with 1q23, resulting in the fusion of the TCF3 (E2A) gene with the PBX1 gene.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the allelic loss of the chromosomal arm 1p. It has been described in gliomas, meningiomas, neuroblastomas, hepatocellular carcinomas, breast carcinomas, acinar prostate adenocarcinomas, pancreatic carcinomas, and adrenal gland adenomas.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the loss of all or part of the short arm of chromosome 1 (1p). It has been described in gliomas, meningiomas, neuroblastomas, hepatocellular carcinomas, breast carcinomas, acinar prostate adenocarcinomas, pancreatic carcinomas, and adrenal gland adenomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to allelic gain within the chromosomal arm 1q.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to allelic gain within the chromosomal arm 1q.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the duplication of all or part of the short arm of chromosome 2.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the loss of all or part of the short arm of chromosome 3.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the allelic loss of all or part of the short arm of chromosome 4.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to loss of all or part of the short arm of chromosome 4 (4p).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the allelic loss of all or part of the long arm of chromosome 11.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the loss of all or part of the long arm of chromosome 11 (11q).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the duplication of all or part of the long arm of chromosome 17.

Concepts.definition: A cytogenetic abnormality that refers to the duplication of all or part of the long arm of chromosome 17.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Abnormalities that occur in human cells and tissues and models of human cancer.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
